p: Greater antioxidant activity was previously reported for rosemary, investigated at three different stages of development, collected near Lake Garda (Italy) [ 50]. The authors compared the essential oils’ radical scavenging capacity at flowering, post-flowering, and vegetative stage. The best activity was observed at flowering stage with IC 50 values of 36.78 μL, followed by post-flowering, and vegetative state (79.69 and 111.94 μg/mL, respectively).
